topic.title: Plain git repository with zeronet
topic.body:
How can i use dumb http to add a git repository inside a folder of a new website? 
I tried setting up the correct hook for it, but doing git clone on the repository address over zeronet doesn't seam to work.
I have a git directory inside the root of the website, and inside that i have a "test" directory which is a git repository. 
Doing `git clone http://127.0.0.1:43110/website/git/test` doesn't work. 
I know i can clone from zeronet's data directory, but I'd like to get it working over http, so that it works through proxies as well

1578271375_1A82FtkVV7GxU5RZvT3GJDGRTJKdq.body:
>[sfs9]
I'll try asking there, thanks
>[filips]
It just says that the repository was not found.
